content: Former constituency of Singapore **Ang Mo Kio Single Member Constituency** ([Traditional Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_character): 宏茂橋單選區;[Simplified Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_character): 宏茂桥单选区) was a [single member constituency](/wiki/Single_member_constituency) in [Ang Mo Kio](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio), Singapore that was formed in 1976 and existed till 1991. ## History In 1976, the constituency was formed from merging parts of [Nee Soon](/wiki/Nee_Soon_Single_Member_Constituency), [Serangoon Gardens](/wiki/Serangoon_Gardens_Single_Member_Constituency) and [Thomson constituencies](/wiki/Thomson_Single_Member_Constituency) and was known as **Ang Mo Kio Constituency**. In 1988, following the establishment of [Group representation constituency](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) (GRC) and SMC, it was known as Ang Mo Kio SMC. In 1991, prior to the [general election](/wiki/1991_Singaporean_general_election), the constituency was merged into [Ang Mo Kio Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio_Group_Representation_Constituency). ## Member of Parliament **Year** **Member****Party****Formation**(/wiki/1976_Singaporean_general_election)[Yeo Toon Chia](/wiki/Yeo_Toon_Chia)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)(/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1984_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election)**Constituency abolished (1991)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1970s [General Election
